channel.title: Comments on: Equipment Review: Dirt Cheap Go Set

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Sure - I guess I just find it interesting to think about what parts of a go set are worth sacrificing for certain savings and which aren't. For me, at least imagining it, it seems like the rigid surface is fundamental to go. This might be more useful, IMO, as a 9x9 or 13x13 board, where it's clearly just a temporary tool for teaching. But, sure - if this has an audience, it's fine. Just thinking aloud.
item.content:encoded:
Sure – I guess I just find it interesting to think about what parts of a go set are worth sacrificing for certain savings and which aren’t. For me, at least imagining it, it seems like the rigid surface is fundamental to go. This might be more useful, IMO, as a 9×9 or 13×13 board, where it’s clearly just a temporary tool for teaching.
But, sure – if this has an audience, it’s fine. Just thinking aloud.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I hear you man, which is why I try to push for the Go Bento Box if at all possible. On the other hand though, I had to account for the fact that there may be people where that price is still out of range. So for that consideration alone, I still felt that at least you were getting a usable go set out of it. Not something I would recommend personally, but there is a case and situation for it, so for those people, I have left my thoughts and consideration to them. =)
item.content:encoded:
I hear you man, which is why I try to push for the Go Bento Box if at all possible. On the other hand though, I had to account for the fact that there may be people where that price is still out of range. So for that consideration alone, I still felt that at least you were getting a usable go set out of it.
Not something I would recommend personally, but there is a case and situation for it, so for those people, I have left my thoughts and consideration to them. =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Maybe I'm spoiled, but I just couldn't imagine recommending a board like this - the squiggly lines caused by a non-rigid surface destroy the satisfying beauty of a normal goban - even a cheap one.
item.content:encoded: Maybe I’m spoiled, but I just couldn’t imagine recommending a board like this – the squiggly lines caused by a non-rigid surface destroy the satisfying beauty of a normal goban – even a cheap one.
